dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris' parents, TOM and JOYCE BUELLER are standing at bedside. They're in their late forties, early fifties. Handsome, upper-middle class parents. They're both dresse for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have a fever. But he says his stomach hurts and he's seeing spots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lifeless eyes blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom bends down and touches Ferris' forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Ferris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel his hands. They're cold and clammy. Tom takes one of Ferris' hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (discreetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should you call the doctor? JOYCE (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want me to. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you want Mom to call the doctor? Ferris exhales loudly. He tries to speak but all he can manage is a choked gasp. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ferris tries again. FERRIS (raspy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make a fuss. I'm fine. I'll get up. He starts to get up. Joyce gently pushes him back down. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a test today. I have to take it. I want to get into a good college so I can have a fruitful life... JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to school like this. (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should call the office and tell them I won't be in. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, Mom. I feel perfectly...Oh, God! He's gripped by a seizure. His body stiffens and he choke His older sister, JEANIE, walks into the room. She's dres for school. She's cute and stuck-up. A major pill. JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fine. What's this? What's his problem? JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't feel well. JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Dry that one out and you can fertilize the lawn. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Jeanie. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not falling for this, are you? Tell me you're not falling for this. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Jeanie? I can't see that far. Jeanie? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pucker up and squat, Ferris. JOYCE (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jeanie. Get to school. JEANIE (angry, defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really letting him stay home? I can't believe this. If I was bleeding out my eyes, you guys'd make me go to school. It's so unfair. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't be upset with me, Jeanie. Be thankful that you're fit and have your health. Cherish it. JEANIE (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I wanna puke. She glares at Ferris. Her eyes are mascara and vengence. slips out of the room. Ferris' brother, TODD and sister, KIMBERLY peek into the room. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myocardial infarction? JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your stuff. Daddy'll be right down. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syphilitic meningitus? That would be a huge family embarrassment. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get downstairs! KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he dies, I got dibs on his stereo. She turns sharply and exits. TODD (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Does my head look alright? JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get downstairs! Now! TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer me one question! Is it swelling up? Kim said it was going to get as big as... KIMBERLY (OC)

dialogues.speaker: A WATERMELON
dialogues.text: TODD (yells out the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up! JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get downstairs! NOW! Todd backs out of the room. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be okay. I'll just sleep. Maybe I'll have an aspirin around noon. JOYCE (to Ferris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm showing houses to the family from California today but I'll be in the area. My office'll know where I am, if you need me. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check it with you, too. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to know I have such loving, caring parents. You're both very special people.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He acknowledges Tom with a pathetic flutter of his eyelid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strokes Ferris' hair. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you feel better, pumpkin. She leans down and kisses his forehead. Tom pats his shoulder. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: Ferris lets out a wheeze. His glassy eyes follow his pare to the door. JOYCE (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We love you, sweetie. TOM (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call if you need us. They close the door. The lock clicks. Ferris' eyes shift from the door to CAMERA. A sly, little smile crawls acros his lips. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bought it. The MTV theme music ROARS IN.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: The TV at the foot of Ferris' bed. The MTV logo is playin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris yanks open the drapes. The pall of the sickroom disappears in the brilliant glow of morning sunlight. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible! One of the worst performances of my career and they never doubted it for a second. (looks out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a beautiful day! He turns from the window. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents always fall for the clammy hands. It's physical evidence of illness. It's a good, non-specific symptom. Parents are generally pretty hip to the fever scams. And to make them work you have to go a hundred and one, hundred and two. You get a nervous mother and you end up in a doctor's office and that's worse than school. He flips on his stereo and fills the room with the MTV broadcast. A NEW SONG begins. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake a stomach cramp and when you're doubled over, moaning and wailing, just lick your palms. It's a little stupid and childish but then so if high school. Right? He equalizes the sound a little. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my ninth sick day with semester. If I go for ten, I'm probably going to have to barf up a lung. So, I absolutely must make this one count. He exits into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris walks into the bathroom. It's littered with Jean's debris. He turns on the shower water. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you're fifty five or seven, everybody needs a day off now and then. It's a beautiful day. How can I be expected to handle high school? He bends down OUT OF FRAME as he loses his briefs. He pop up. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do actually have a test. That wasn't bullshit. He steps into the shower. Through the pebbled glass of th shower door we see Ferris' outline. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I care about it was. 12  INT. BATHROOM. SHOWER STALL. Inside the shower. Ferris' hair is standing straight up. It's moulded into a fin with shampoo. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on European socialism. I mean, really. What's the point? I'm not European. I don't plan to be European. So, who gives a shit if they're socialists? They could be fascist anarchists and it still wouldn't change the fact that I don't own a car. He turns the shower head around and uses it like a microphone. FERRIS (sings)

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY. LATER
dialogues.text: Ferris comes out of the bathroom with a towel wrapped aro his waist. He's drying his hair with another of a differe color. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I condone fascism. Or and "isms". "Isms", in my opinion are not good. A person should not believe in an "ism". He should believe in himself. John Lennon said it on his first solo album. "I don't believe in Beatles, I just believe in me." A good point there. Afterall, he was the Walrus. He opens a linen closet and tosses the towel in it. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be the Walrus and I'd still have to bum rides off people. He passes CAMERA and goes into his room. FERRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not very political? Let me put that into perspective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris tosses the towel he's dried hair with on the bed. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle went to Canada to protest the war, right? On the Fourth of July he was down with my aunt and he got drunk and told my Dad he felt guilty he didn't fight in Viet Nam. So I said, "What's the deal, Uncle Jeff? In wartime you want to be a pacifist and in peacetime you want to be a soldier. It took you twenty years to find out you don't believe in anything?" (snaps his fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grounded. Just like that. Two weeks. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful when you deal with old hippies. They can be real touchy. He opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Ferris rifles through his shirts. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was a hippie. But she lost it. She got old. If she listens to the White Album now? She doesn't hear music, she hears memories. Nostalgia is her favorite drug. It'll probably be mine, too. I hope not. He finds a shirt he likes. He steps back from the closet puts it on. He drops the towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks across the room to his dresser. He opens his underwear drawer. There's an old model of a submarine on top of the dresser. He picks it up. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In eighth grade a friend of mine made a bong out of one of these. The smoke tasted like glue. He pulls out a pair of underwear. He gets dressed as he speaks. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Garth Volbeck. He's a serious outsider. Not a bad guy, I like him. I'm probably his only friend. I do what I can for him. I mean, if I was him, I'd appreciate it. Do unto others, right? Anyway, his mother owns a gas station. His father's dead and his sister's rumored to be a prostitute, which is complete bullshit. She only puts out so people will hang out with her. It's sad but I don't hold it against her. Better to hold it against the guys who use her and don't care about her. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents never allowed Garth over here. It was because of his family. Mainly his older brother. He's in jail. I could see them not wanting his brother here because he is a registered psycho. I wouldn't want him here. I once watched the guy eat a whole bowl of artificial fruit just so he could see what it was like to have his stomach pumped. But Garth isn't his brother. It isn't his fault that his brother's screwed-up. Alot of fights with the parents on that point. I always felt for Garth. I was sleeping at his house once and I was laying on the dark worrying that his brother was going to come in and hack me to death with an ax and I heard Garth crying. I asked him what was wrong and he said, "Nothing". ... Nothing was wrong. There was no specific thing he was crying about. In fact, he wasn't really even aware that he was crying. He just cried himself to sleep every night. It was a habit. The guy's so conditioned to grief that if he doesn't feel it, he can't sleep. How could you possibly dump on guy who has to deal with that kinda shit? My parents acknowledge the trudge of the situation and I'm sure that deep down, they do feel for him but still the guy's banned from our house. He looks at himself in the mirror on the back of his clos door. He doesn't like what he's wearing. He continues his speech as he disrobes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, now my parents have a legit argument. Garth doesn't need his brother to give him a rep anymore. He's getting one on his own. He's lost. It's over for him. He's eighteen. Gone from school. Gone from life. His legacy is a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris comes down the stairs. He's wearing a completely different outfit. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One very serious danger is playing sick is that it's possible to believe your own act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris comes into the kitchen and crosses to the refrigerator. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That and boredom. Alot of people ditch and feel great for about an hour. Then they realize there's nothing to do. TV and food. I myself have ditched and gotten so bored I did homework. Figure that shit out. He takes a sip out of a bottle of orange juice. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to plan things out before you take the day off. Otherwise you get all nervous worrying about what to do and all you get is grief and the whole point is to take it easy, cut loose and enjoy. He crosses to the pantry. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blow your day and at about three o'clock, when everybody's out of school, you're going to wish you'd gone to school so you could be out having fun. He emerges from the pantry with a handful of Oreos. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avoid the misery. Plan your day. Do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris walks in and flops down in an armchair. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's alot of pressure at work in my age group. And it's not always recognized. He reaches over and picks up the telephone. He sets it in his lap. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guy whose hair is falling out and his stomach's hanging over his belt and everything he eats makes him fart, he looks at someone like me and thinks, "This kid's young and strong and has a full, rich future ahead of him, what's he got to bitch about?"

dialogues.speaker: CU. PHONE
dialogues.text: He punches out a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He remote controls the TV on. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just one reason why I need a day off every now and then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek, modern house on a couple of deeply wooded acres. prime house in a prime location. A telephone rings OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dark, dreary sick room. Shades drawn, floor strewn with used tissues, nightstand a still-life of over the counter remedies. A high school boy, CAMERON FRYE, is lay in bed. We don't see his face, only a silhouette with a thermometer sticking out his mouth. U2's SUNDAY BLOODY SUNDAY is playing. He's mumbling random words. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food...shelter...no...yes... The phone rings. His hand reaches back and hits the speak phone button. CAMERON (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron! What's happening? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very little. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shredded. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your mother in the room? Cameron takes the thermometer out of his mouth. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not home. Where are you? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is sprawled out in the chair. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the day off. Get dressed and come over. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sick. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in your head. Come on over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's insistant. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like complete shit, Ferris. I can't go anywhere. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Now, come on over and pick me up. Ferris disconnects. Cameron slowly hangs up the phone. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying. The phone rings again. Cameron hits the speaker button. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not dying. You just can't think of anything good to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris hangs up. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anybody needs a day off, it's Cameron. He has alot of things to sort out before he graduates. He can't be wound this tight and go to college. His roommate'll kill him. I've come close myself. But I like him. He's a little easier to take when you know why he's like he is. The boy cannot relax. Pardon by French but Cameron is so tight that if you stuck a lump of coal up his ass, in two weeks you'd have a diamond. (after-thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cameron would worry that he'd owe taxes on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear roll call as CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the tile floor. shoe's POV. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albers? BOY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson. GIRL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. CAMERA enters a classroom. It travels past a teacher's Hu Puppies and heads up an aisle of desk past dirty yellow Reebocks, rotting Air Jordans, scuffed heels, pristine loafers... TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anheiser? BOY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busch? GIRL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bueller? CAMERA reaches the last desk and rises slowly to reveal t it's empty. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bueller? GIRL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best friend's sister's boyfriend's brother's girlfriend heard from this guy who knows this kid who's going with a girl who saw Ferris pass-out at 31 Flavors last night. I guess it's pretty serious. TEACHER'S VOICE (weary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Simone. GIRL'S VOICE (cheery)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem whatsoever. TEACHER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drucker? BOY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? WOUND-OUT CAR ENGINES COME UP LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV
dialogues.text: THE ROAD WARRIOR is playing on video cassette. The big ch at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sitting in the arm chair pretending it's Humongous' wagon. He's wearing a hockey mash. He's steering. He reac down and grabs an imaginary nitrous oxide valve.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV
dialogues.text: Humongous reaches down and grabs a real nitrous oxide val He gives it a twist.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He throws himself back against the chair.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV
dialogues.text: The force of the rapid acceleration of his vehicle throws Humongous back in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He bounces himself in the chair to simulate the bumpy hig speed ride.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV
dialogues.text: The was wagon hurtles down the road.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He rears back in horror.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV
dialogues.text: The war wagon is heading for a head-on collision with the tanker truck.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: Arms outstretched, head thrown back, braced for collision

dialogues.speaker: CU. FLOWERING TREE BRANCH
dialogues.text: Outside a bedroom window. A flowering crabtree branch. Petite pink flowers. WE PULL BACK FROM THE WINDOW INTO TH ROOM. It's Jeanie's room. A pink and powder blue pig pen. Clothes everywhere, make-up, books, records. Ferris is sitting on her bed going through a purse. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really degrading. He comes up with a crumpled dollar bill. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Financing my activities this way. Very damaging to the self-image. But, hey, I'm broke. In times of crisis one must to what one must to. I'll pay it back. With interest. He comes up with a five. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless of how much shit sisters make you eat, how often they rat on you, how gross they act or how wicked and insensitive they can be, you should not alientate them. Because most likely they have cash and it's usually very easy to get your hands on. He holds up a twenty and snaps it. PINK FLOYD'S "MONEY" COMES UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song plays as Ferris digs through the sofa cushions.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SOFA
dialogues.text: Ferris extracts a sticky quarter from a crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is going through his father's pants pockets. Anoth crumpled bill surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: CU. WASHING MACHINE TOP
dialogues.text: A couple of stiff, hard, bleached singles that have gone through the wash lay on top of the washer. A hand scoops them up.

dialogues.speaker: CU. LUCITE ENCASED PROOF SET
dialogues.text: An obvious gift from a grandparent. A U.S. Mint proof set ten, a five and a single enclosed in a lucite frame. A screwdriver tip wedges between the two pieces of Lucite a pops them apart. A hand peels the bills off the backing.

dialogues.speaker: CU. KITCHEN DRAWER
dialogues.text: Hands ripping through the kitchen junk drawer. Locating a dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: CU. COIN COLLECTION
dialogues.text: The familiar blue collector's album. One-by-one, the quarters are being popped out of their slots.

dialogues.speaker: CU. VACCUUM CLEANER
dialogues.text: The dusty, dirty contents of the bag are emptied on the floor. Fingers pick a dime out of a matted wad of filth.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SNOOPY BANK
dialogues.text: It's being shaken furiously.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BIRTHDAY CARD
dialogues.text: It's a child's card. It's slowly opened to reveal a crisp new five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Ferris thrusts his hands into the pock of the coats. He comes up with a ball of Kleenex. A roll Tums. A squirt gun. Then a modest wad of bills. His face lights up as he counts out the cash. He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FLOOR AND BED
dialogues.text: Ferris' face appears between the bed and the floor. His a reaches out for a small metal bank hidden under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BANK
dialogues.text: It's on a work bench. An awl is driven in between the doo and the jamb. It pries the door open. Inside are trading cards, a charred doll's head, a Zippo lighter and, finall a five dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is on his hands and knees under the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TABLE LEG
dialogues.text: Ferris lifts the leg and removes a quarter that's been us to balance the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris stands up and pockets the quarter.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS' BED
dialogues.text: A shower of coins and bills rain down on the sheets. The SONG ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. REAL ESTATE OFFICE. MORNING
dialogues.text: A suburban realty company. A cute little building in town

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce is behind a desk. Across from her are two WOMEN. They're also real estate agents. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's going to consider a house with a black living room. Not even those jerks from Vermont. Let's be realistic. AGENT 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Volbeck's dead set against putting any money into the house. Joyce's phone intercom buzzes. She take the call. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce Bueller. Her eyes open wide with alarm. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. I'm so sorry. I completely forgot to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modern, suburban high school. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you aware that your son is not in school today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a passing period. The hall is clogged with students. JOYCE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. Ferris is home sick. I had a meeting first thing this morning. I should have called. It completely slipped my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY is at work at her desk. We hear the dean insi the office. DEAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you also aware that Ferris does not have what we consider an exemplary attendance record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads, EDWARD R. ROONEY. DEAD OF STUDENTS. The dean's feet are up on the desk, behind the sign. Moderately pric dress shoes. JOYCE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. DEAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had his file up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED ROONEY is sitting behind his desk. He's tough, clean a straight as an I-beam. Short, neatly combed hair, suit an tie. He's toying with a pencil. He's confident to the poi of arrogance. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just has his file up, Mrs. Bueller. Behind him is a computer terminal. He removes his feet fr the desk and turns in his swivel chair. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Ferris thinks he coast this last month and still graduate, he's sorely mistaken. JOYCE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all news to me.

dialogues.speaker: CU. COMPUTER MONITOR
dialogues.text: The monitor on Rooney's desk displays Ferris' records. ROONEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far this semester alone, he's been absent nine times. Including today. JOYCE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine times? Under DAYS MISSED we see a number 9 suddenly change to a number 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney turns to the monitor. He reads off the screen. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it right here in front of me. He's missed... He looks closer at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is at his Macintosh computer. He has his record up on the screen. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted a car. I got a computer. How's that for being born under a bad sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still on the phone with Rooney. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can give you every assurance that Ferris is home and that he is, in fact, very ill. I debated whether or not I should even leave him. I can appreciate that at this time of year children are prone to taking the day off, but in Ferris' case, he's truly a very sick boy.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: The grille cloth is throbbing.

dialogues.speaker: CU. LED METERS
dialogues.text: The meters on the amplifier are totally in the danger zon

dialogues.speaker: CU. TV MONITOR
dialogues.text: We see Ferris in his room with a guitar around his neck. He's playing.

dialogues.speaker: CU. VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: A home video camera is capturing Ferris on tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sitting on the edge of the bed buttoning his shirt. sighs deeply and fall back on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie is at her locker during a passing period. A GIRLFRIEND comes up to her. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry about your brother. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you sorry for? I have to live with the trouser snake. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean I heard he's really sick. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said he's sick. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole bunch of people. They said he's like on the verge of death. Jeanie stares incredulously at the girl. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy in my biology class said that if Ferris dies he's giving his eyes to Stevie Wonder? He's really sweet isn't he? She smiles and exits. Jeanie cocks her head in bewilderme She kicks her locker shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in bed on the phone. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sample of my blood was sent to Atlanta to the Center for Disease Control. I don't know, man, I'm bricking heavily. (point to the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshman. (to the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Alien? When the guy had the creature in his stomach? It feels like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FRESHMAN BOY is on the pay phone. A couple of his BUDDI are standing at his side waiting anxiously for news. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn! Are you kidding? SECOND BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Alien? SECOND BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never rented the video cassette? Second boy shakes his head, no. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. He's really wasted. THIRD BOY (to the Second Boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he talking to? SECOND BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller. You know him? THIRD BOY (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's getting me out of summer school. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I appreciate you letting us know how you're doing. We gotta split. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?...Yeah, sure. Hold on. SECOND BOY (to Third Boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I hope he doesn't die. I can't handle summer school. The boy snatches a passing GIRL. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Alien? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? He hands her the phone. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ferris. How's your bod? (jaw drops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! You're dying? Is it serious? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shiit! Are you upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's comparing his computer monitor to hard copy. His SECRETARY is standing over his shoulder. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust this kid any further than I can throw him! SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your bad knee, you better not throw anybody, Ed. Rooney stares at her for a long beat. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so dangerous about a character like Ferris Bueller is that he gives the good kids bad ideas. The last thing I need at this point in my career is fifteen hundred Ferris Bueller disciples running around these halls. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very popular, Ed. Sportos, motorheads, geeks, sluts, pinheads, dweebies, wonkers, richies, they all adore him. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly why I have to catch him this time. To show these kids that the example he sets is a first class ticket to nowhere. SECRETARY (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo. You sounded like Dirty Harry just now. Rooney looks up at her with a proud smile. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? He unconsciously does an Eastwood squint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a glorious late spring day. A florist's truck drives past the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the telephone. As he speaks he does a little MacPainting on his MacIntosh. A Modigliani nude. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, if you're not over here in fifteen minutes, you can find a new best friend. I'm serious, man. This is bullshit, making me wait around the house for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's back in bed. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick. I feel like shit. Why can't you leave me alone? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not up for some good times? It's a beautiful day. It's almost summer. If this was Hawaii, we'd be surfing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's growing weary of Cameron's wimpishness. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to stay home and try to have the shits? Try to barf? Try to feel worse? CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to try. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a man. Take some Pepto Bismol and get dressed. You're boring me with this stuff. The other phone line rings. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeeze you buns for a second. I got another call. He puts Cameron on hold. He clears his throat and answers the second line. He sounds like he's on his last breath. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H--hell-o?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LaSalle Street office tower. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's behind his desk. Nice office. Two windows. Herman Miller desk and chair. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound miserable. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Darn! I thought I was improving. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you sleeping? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to do some homework.

dialogues.speaker: CU. COMPUTER MONITOR
dialogues.text: A closer view of the rude drawing Ferris is making. FERRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so worried about falling behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back from the monitor and sips a Coke. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Can you hold on a second? TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, pal. Are you alright? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little phlegm on the phone. Hold on. He puts his father on hold. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? It's my Dad. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's just great. Are you busted? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's completely cool. He's just checking up on me. Now, listen to me. I'm working on getting some heavy bucks out of him. So, the least you can do is hurry up and get over here. Bye. He disconnects and gets his father back. He switches back his sick voice. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad. The moment before you called, I had a chest spasm and I blew lung fluid all over the place. It was making me ill looking at it. But gee, it's sure great of you to call. I'm sure there're alot of fathers who wouldn't take time out from their busy schedules to call a dumb, sick teenager. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal, what was I supposed to do? Ferris reaches out and hits a key on his computer. The screen dumps the drawing. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give yourself some credit, Dad. It was a mammoth gesture. It's like those savings bonds you used to give me every Christmas. (looks at CAMERA and smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was that kind of concern.

dialogues.speaker: CU. COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: A message is flashing: "TRANSMITTING DATA".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from the computer and puts his feet up on t desk. He lights a cigarette. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to work hard for the money to buy those things, right? TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any harder than anybody else. Ferris mouths Tom's words as he says them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris' drawing suddenly appears on the billboard. Pedestrians stop to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows a smoke ring. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work so hard I'll bet you don't even remember where those bonds are, right? Ferris points a finger in the air as a cue to his father. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. He nods. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? You're pulling my leg. You're just trying to cheer me up. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell I am. They're in a shoebox in my closet. Ferris smiles. He looks at CAMERA. He's gotten exactly wh he wants. FERRIS (to CAMERA, normal voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that a class move or what? The guy gave it up faster than a drunk Catholic girl. I hope my kids don't pull this shit on me. (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, if they didn't, they'd be dumb and abnormal and they'd probably never move out of my house and I'd have to support them until I die. I take it back. (to the phone, sick voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? All this talking has made me kind of light-headed. I think I better lie down. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, pal. You take care. I'll call you after lunch. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to, Dad. TOM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to. Bye now. He hangs up. Ferris sighs. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win some, you lose some. He turns his desk chair around and gets up. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so disappointed in Cameron. Twenty bucks says he's sitting in his car debating about whether or not he should go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sitting behind the wheel of his car. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get caught. No doubt about it. He cuts the engine. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing it. He sits for half a beat. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll keep calling until I come over. He sighs and restarts the engine. Another beat. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, what'll happen is I'll get caught. Ferris'll escape. Another beat. He stops the engine. A CRASH OF HORROR MUSI

dialogues.speaker: CU. DRESSER DRAWER
dialogues.text: Hands curl around the drawer pulls. The drawer is opened slowly, ominously. The hands lift a sweater out. A HERALD STING as we see a men's magazine beneath the sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out the magazine. He leafs through the pages for the pictorials as he speaks. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron'll go on like that for a good thirty minutes. The guy is a shellfish when it comes to making a decision. The reason he doesn't fell good is, he worries about everything. He's the only guy I know who's deeply concerned that when he grows up there'll be a critical shortage of strategic metals. He exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris comes out of his room and heads down the hallway. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's also the only guy I know who knows what strategic metals are. (waves the magazine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon moi. He goes into the bathroom. We HEAR THE TOILET SEAT SLAM DOWN. FERRIS (sings)

dialogues.speaker: INT. CLASSROOM. LATER
dialogues.text: A stunningly beautiful girl, SLOANE PETERSON, is sitting her desk in a history class. She's staring out the window a tweedy MALE TEACHER delivers a dry, dusty lecture. TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roosevelt's health had seriously deteriorated by the time he met with Churchill and Stalin at Yalta. (sneezes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me. The classroom door opens and the school NURSE walks in. F a moment, the teacher thinks she's come in because she he him sneeze. She crosses to him and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: SLOANE
dialogues.text: She, like the others, watches the nurse curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher's face drops as he's delivered an obvious pie of disturbing news. He nods grimly to the Nurse. She look at the kids. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane Peterson?

dialogues.speaker: SLOANE
dialogues.text: Sits up in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: She's a picture of compassion and understanding. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see you outside for a moment? There's been an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: SLOANE
dialogues.text: A smile curls across her lips. As she gathers her books s looks to the GIRL next to her. SLOANE (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse is gently holding Sloane's hand. NURSE (nods solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He has a suspicious look on his face. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's at his desk. His secretary is standing across fr him. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Mr. Peterson said. I had Florence Sparrow notify Sloane. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this girl's going with? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so hard to tell. I see her alot with Ferris Bueller. Rooney smiles. His suspicions are confirmed. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you get me Mr. Peterson's daytime number? As the secretary starts out of the room, Rooney's phone rings. She stops and answers the desk phone. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward Rooney's office. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Can you hold? Thank you. She puts the call on hold. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mr. Peterson. Rooney is startled. He thinks for a beat then reaches for the phone. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want his number? Rooney answers her with an annoyed look. She smiles and backs out. He punches the phone button. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Rooney. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed? This is George Peterson. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you today, sir? MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had a bit of bad luck this morning as you may have heard. Rooney rolls his eyes. It's so obvious it's not Mr. Peterson. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. And, gosh, I'm all broken up. Huh? Oh, sure. I'd be happy to release Sloane. You produce a corpse and I'll release Sloane. I want to see this dead grandmother firsthand. The secretary stops cold in the doorway. She turns to Roo in horror. He covers the phone. ROONEY (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ferris Bueller. Nervy litttle punk. I'm gonna set a trap and let his walk right into it! (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Cart the stiff in and I'll turn over your daughter. It's school policy. Was this your mother? Rooney's other line rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps out of Rooney's office and picks up the other line. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Rooney's office. Her jaw drops. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold, please. She puts the call on hold and hangs up. She hurried into Rooney's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's chewing out the person on the other line. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you want, you don't like my policies, you can just come on down and smooch by big old ugly ass. You hear me? The secretary comes in. She's waving her arms furiously. Rooney tries to wave her away. He's angry. She stomps her foot. Rooney covers the phone. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller's on line two.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY'S FOOT
dialogues.text: It freezes in mid-tap.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY'S HAND
dialogues.text: The pencils falls from his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY'S FACE
dialogues.text: A mask of horror. He glances at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PHONE
dialogues.text: The second line light is flashing.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He blinks, cocks his head, twitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's zipping his pants, fastening his belt. The phone's cradled against his shoulder. He speaks in the same voice used on his father. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rooney? I'm sorry to disturb you at work but I was wondering if it would be possible for my sister to bring home any assignments from my classes that I may need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's staring blankly ahead. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PHONE
dialogues.text: Rooney's finger gingerly presses the button on the waitin call.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He winces as he returns to the first call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's on the phone in the kitchen. He's doing a deep, phoney "father" voice. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta be sorry for Christ's sake! A family member dies and you insult me. What's the matter with you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He apologies profusely to Cameron. He's perspiring, trembling. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I thought you were someone else. You have to know, sir, that I would never deliberately insult you. I can't begin to tell you how embarrassed I am. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my French but you're an asshole! Rooney nods enthusiastically. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely! I most certainly am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron lays into Rooney. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't over yet, buster. You just make sure my daughter's out in front of the school in ten minutes. Do you read me? ROONEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load and clear, Mr. Peterson. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me sir, goddamn it! ROONEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. Ferris strolls into the kitchen to catch the last of the conversation. Cameron covers the phone. CAMERON (to Ferris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared shitless, Ferris! What is Rooney guesses my voice! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible. You're doing great. Cameron sighs and goes back to the phone. CAMERON (clears his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have all day to bark at you so I'll make this short and sweet. Ferris gives Cameron an enthusiastic thumbs up. FERRIS (mouths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Cameron smiles proudly. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my daughter out in front of the school in ten minutes. By herself. I don's want anyone around... Ferris smacks Cameron. He's said the wrong thing. He cove the phone. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I do? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in front my herself? It's too suspicious! He'll think something's up, moron. Cover it. Cameron panics. He holds the phone out to Ferris. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do it! Ferris waves his arms angrily. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk! Cameron takes a deep breath. He clears his throat and put on his father's voice. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind, fella. You be out in front with her! I wanna have a few words with you! Ferris slaps Cameron. The phone flies out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He winces as the phone hits the floor with a loud CLONK! We HEAR THE BOYS SCRAMBLING TO PICK UP THE PHONE, THEN CAMERON CLEARING HIS THROAT. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On second thought, I don't have time to talk to you. We'll get together soon and have lunch. We HEAR A SLAP AND THE CALL DISCONNECTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's rubbing the side of his head. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you hit me?! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your brain?! CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you hit me?! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your brain?! CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you hit me? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your brain? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you first. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we pick up Sloane if Rooney's going to be there with her?! CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said for her to be there alone and you freaked! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, God, you're so stupid! (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hit you, I lightly slapped you. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit me. Look, don't ask me to participate in your crap if you don't like the way I do it! Ferris is incredulous at Cameron's stupidity. Cameron's anger is intensified by his embarrassment. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was home, sick. You get me out of bed, being me over here, make me jeopardize my future, make me do a phoney phone call on a dean of students, a man who could squeeze my nuts into oblivion and then you deliberately hurt my feelings. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't deliberately hurt your feelings. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really. Cameron glares at Ferris. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ferris? Have a nice life. He turns and heads out of the room. Ferris sighs. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick it up your ass, Ferris. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to jam you. It was uncalled for. Cameron stops. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious? He turns around. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead serious. Cameron smiles. He appreciates Ferris apology. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did screw up through, right? Not that is was necessarily all you fault. Right? CAMERON (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fix this situation, I'm going to have to ask you for a small favor. Cameron's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens slowly, dramatically as we hear a heraldic fanfare. Light streams in to reveal Cameron and Ferris looking at the car. Ferris is smiling with excitement and awe. Cameron is frowning with trepidation and fear.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRARI STALLION
dialogues.text: The prancing black stallion. We move up from the stallion the erotic red hood of a 1958 Ferrari 250 GTS California.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON AND FERRIS
dialogues.text: Cameron's face is ashen. The end of the world is at hand. Ferris is in heaven. CAMERON (grim monotone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1958 Ferrari 250 GTS California. Less than a hundred were made. It has a market value of $265,000. My father spent three years restoring it. It is joy, it is his love, it is his passion. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is his fault he didn't lock the garage. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, my father loves this car more than life itself. We can't take is out. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man with priorities so far out of whack doesn't deserve such a fine automobile. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never drives it, Ferris. He just rubs it with a diaper. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't pick up Sloane in your car, Cameron. Rooney'd never believe Mr. Peterson drives that piece of shit. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a piece of shit. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a piece of shit. Don't worry about it. I don't even have a piece of shit. I have to envy yours. Look, I'm sorry but there's nothing else we can do. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows the mileage, Ferris. He has it tatooed on his wrist. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't trust you? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, look, this is real simple. He puts his arm around Cameron. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever miles we put on it, we'll take off. CAMERON (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? FERRIS (big, proud smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll drive home backwards. Cameron shakes his head, no. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I'm putting my foot down, Ferris. You'll have to think of something else...

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRARI GRILLE
dialogues.text: Cameron's protests are drowned out by the distinctive roa of the twelve cylinders. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're not talking me into this one. I have to live with the man. I'm sorry but... The roar of the engine is overtaken by the sound of a crowded school hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes out of a classroom. She stops as Sloane and Roo walk past. Sloane has her coat on and she's carrying her books. Jeanie watches her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari is parked out in front. The top is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is driving. He's wearing a man's hat and sunglasse Cameron's in the back. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! Put the top back up! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is perfect top-down weather. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Rooney? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, the more obvious we are, the less likely we are to get caught. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes no sense whatsoever. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The adult mind is a suspicious machine. (look around at Cameron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down, man. Cameron squeezes himself lower. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howcome it's my Dad's car and I'm taking all the risk and I have to ride back here? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney and Sloane come out the door. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again let me say how deeply saddened I am by your loss. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you close to your grandmother? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Um. Yeah. Very. She was a terrific lady. Very hip. Very old. Yeah. DEEP VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sloane! Dear! Sloane looks across at the Ferrari. Rooney looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is looking out across the roof of the Ferrari. He' careful to keep his nose and mouth below the roofline. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry along now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's suspicious. Sloane smiles and bids Rooney a hast farewell. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's my Dad. Thanks. See ya. She hurries to the car. Rooney watches her. Something doe compute for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's watching out the door. She sees the Ferrari pull aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't quite put his finger on what's bothering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane shrieks with delight. She leans across the console and gives Ferris a kiss. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so great! I can't believe it! Right in front of Rooney! She laughs and turns to Cameron. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cameron. You comfortable? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. No. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fabulous car! CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy it quick. It' s going home. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was risky, it was bold but it was totally necessary. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question isn't "what are we gonna do", the question is "what aren't we going to do." CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me we're not going to take the car home. Please. FERRIS (to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had access to a car like this would you take it back right away? Would you give up feeling like a ton just to ease your best friend's tension? He smiles. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either would I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It accelerates away like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fresh, modern bank building. The clock outside read 9:5 The Ferrari pulls into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cameron and Sloane walk in. Ferris is cocky and confident. Sloane's still intoxicated with her freedom. Cameron's having stomach trouble. Ferris leads the way to open teller window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN about seventy with a silver blue beehive. It's ab four inches higher the highest beehive you're ever seen. she moves the beehive hits a small sign over her head. Sh been at the bank since they opened. She smiles when she s Ferris. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: He's at the window. On either shoulder are Cameron and Sloane. Ferris smiles. Cameron blanches. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Froeling. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: She pats the rock-solid mass of blue hair. In doing so sh locates a missing ball point pen. She withdraws it from t hair and smiles at it's reappearance. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I passed a kidney stone Tuesday, so I'm a little pooped but other than that, I'm as chipper as can be. (something occurs to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, should you be in school?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: He lays his savings bonds on the counter. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? (polite laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of school, Mrs. Froeling. In fact. I'm married. This is my wife...Madonna. Sloane suppresses a laugh. FERRIS (to Cameron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is my brother-in-law, ZZ Top. ZZ, this is Mrs. Froeling. Cameron isn't amused. TELLER (to Cameron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Top a Slavic name? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to cash these in, please. We're having a baby and we need the cash for a crib, clothes, diapers, food pellets, leash, water dish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Froeling takes the bonds with a hearty smile. The latter part of the conversation sails over her like a lin drive. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby! (to Sloane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be so excited. Cameron groans and turns away from the sham. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thrilled, ma'am. I'm especially looking forward to wearing those jeans with the stretch panel in front. Mrs. Froeling thumbs through the bonds. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hoping for a boy or a girl? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we're hoping for a car.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He's spooked by the games playing. He scans the bank nervously. He blinks, focuses, blinks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce is with a MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE and their bored, sour-puss teenage son, BOYD. He's sitting in a chair with his legs slung over the sides waving a Bic lighter back a forth across his rump. The parents are Joyce's clients fr Vermont. A LOAN OFFICER is discussing the local financing situation with them. His is an open office adjacent to th teller windows. Joyce's back is to the tellers.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: It's like he's just witnesses an ax murder. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her back is to the teller windows. She's conducting her meeting. Behind her we see Cameron grab Ferris and point out to him. He waves. Cameron slaps his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Froeling shows Ferris the savings bonds. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These bonds aren't mature. If you hold onto them another two years you'll get an additional four dollars... FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that. TELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're throwing away four dollars. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am, I'm giving it to the government. They need it. Do you know what an aircraft carrier's going for these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She concludes her meeting. She shakes hands with the loan officer and stands. The Vermont Couple stands. Boyd scrap the bottom of his shoe on the desk, leaving a glob of mud behind and he stands. Joyce turns into the bank. Ferris, Cameron and Sloane are gone. She escorts her customers ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and the Vermont Couple approach the doors. Boyd lay luggie in the drinking fountain. Mrs. Froeling passes wit the savings bonds. She stops when she sees Joyce. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Froeling, how are you? MRS. FROELING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I passed a kidney stone Tuesday. (shifts gears, to Joyce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, you must be very proud. Joyce doesn't know what she's talking about. MRS. FROELING (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met Madonna. She pats Joyce on the arm. MRS. FROELING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me everything. Keep me posted, I'll want to send a gift. She toodles on her way. Joyce and the Vermont Couple are completely baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and the Vermont Couple walk along the side of the bank, heading for the parking lot. Boyd's tagging along behind. He picks up a stone and hurls it into the parking lot. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son's home sick today. If you wouldn't mind, on our way back to the office, I'd like to just run in and check up on him. We HEAR A METALLIC PING! as Boyd's missle hits a car. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. They pass a show window. As they pass, we hold on the window. It's promoting saving for college educations. A mannequin father is congratulating his mannequin son in a mortar and gown as a stiff Sloane, Ferris and Cameron loo on proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His secretary is dialing a number for him. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Peterson's home. She hands the phone to Rooney. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth this time. Rooney glares at her. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller's behind this. There's no doubt in my mind. That's what I was saying this morning. Why he has to be stopped. He's got Sloane Peterson involved in this thing now. See? The secretary nods. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her grandmother, too.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PHONE ANSWER MACHINE
dialogues.text: It clicks on. We hear a grieved woman's voice. It sounds awful lot like Sloane. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't come to the phone right now. We've had a death in the family. If you need to reach us we'll be at the following number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney quickly takes down a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His answering machine clicks on. We hear Cameron's voice. CAMERON'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reached the Coughlin Bros. Mortuary. We are unable to come to the phone right now but if you'll leave your name and number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney hangs up the phone. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on, goddamn it. The secretary's looking at a newspaper on Rooney's desk. She's not listening to him. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a railroad strike. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to stop it! SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother-in-law'll appreciate it. Rooney looks at her, puzzled. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother-in-law rides the train to work. Rooney stares at her like she's crazy. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a good goddamn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The major thoroughfare into the city of Chicago from the suburbs. The Ferrari streaks past. In the distance we see the Sears Tower, the Hancock Building and the Standard Oi Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's walking down the hall. She's stopped by a KID wi a Coke can. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. We're collecting money to buy Ferris Bueller a new kidney. Jeanie stares at him. She's flabbergasted at the proporti her brother's scan has reached. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run about fifty g's so it you could help out... JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go piss up a flagpole! KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? She knocks the can out of his hands and storms down the h The kid yells after her. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, babe! Some day you might need a favor from Ferris Bueller! Then where'll you be?! He reaches for the can. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heartless wench...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari pulls into a large parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Sloane and Cameron get out. Cameron's having fits CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave the car here! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we can't! I want it back home where it belongs! SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could happen to it? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could get stolen, wrecked, scratched, you name it. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give the guy a five to watch it. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: CU. PARKING ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: He smiles with relish at the car. 6'6", 240. An IQ that equals his hourly wage. Shoulder-length hair stuffed into hairnet Gold teeth. Earring. Goatee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant swaggers over to the car. Ferris slips him give. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak English? ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was three. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I want to you take extra special care of this vehicle, okay? He pats the Attendant on the arm. He smiles. ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it's a beautiful woman. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it. The Attendant very gingerly gets into the car. Ferris tur to Cameron. The Ferrari pulls into the lot very slowly, v carefully. No squealing tires, no revving engine. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what a finski can do to a person's attitude? He's going to treat it like a beautiful woman. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Whip it with a stick and piss on the hood. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Cameron. Do you have to be so graphic? She heads down the street. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so right! Ferris nudges Cameron on. They exit the garage and head after Sloane. A long beat and the Ferrari creeps down the exit ramp of the garage. It's gone in the entrance and ou the exit. Another attendant jumps in the passenger side. He's skinny, tall, with a huge knit hat willed with dread He lets out a spirited laugh and the Ferrari peels out of the lot. It heads down the street away from Sloane, Ferri and Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce's care pulls in the driveway. She gets out and head the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. There's a figure in the bed. We hear soft snoring. A wire runs from under the bed covers to the clo door to the door to the room itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wire is tied to the doorknob. It's taut. Downstairs, hear a door open and close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce quietly walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce comes up the stairs and crosses to Ferris' room. Sh listens at the door. WE HEAR THE SNORING.

dialogues.speaker: CU. DOORKNOB
dialogues.text: Joyce slowly turns the doorknob and pushes the door open crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and the figure-like lump in the bed moves.

dialogues.speaker: CU. JOYCE
dialogues.text: She smiles and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door is open. The wire from the bedroom door i strung over the top of the closet door. A trophy is attac to the end of the wire and it's resting on a yard stick. the bedroom door closes, the trophy lifts up off the yardstick and the lump in the bed goes back down to it's original position.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS' SYNTHESIZER
dialogues.text: Little LED's are lighting up to the rhythm of the snoring The snoring it simulated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce listens at the door another beat. She's smiles with relief and affection.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SEARS TOWER. LATER
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SHOT moves in on the world's tallest building. it passes we see three figures pressed against the window FERRIS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the world's tallest building. From our vantage point here on the 103 floor, we are provided with a view of four states. CAMERON (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think the car's alright? FERRIS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illinois, Michigan, Wisconsin and my personal favorite, Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cameron and Sloane are standing against the windo CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel good, Ferris. Are we gonna stay long? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a step back... Ferris steps back. Sloane and Cameron follow suit. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, lean against the glass. Like this... He leans forward, putting all his weight on his forehead. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look down. Sloane leans forward. Cameron follows, reluctantly. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street far, far below. A dizzying view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three are leaning against the glass. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the glass gives? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He's looking down. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I see my Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middle-aged man, Cameron's father, HORACE FRYE, is standing on the street corner. He's lean, clean, tough an humorless. He's wearing a puzzled look on his face. CAMERON'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I see my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari screams down the avenue and disappears down t underground ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Sloane bound down the escalator. Cameron follo glumly. They dance past the giant Calder mobile. They're singing. FERRIS AND SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Sloane burst out the doors garnering the annoy stares of the business people busily going in and out of building. Cameron politely waits his turn to exit. Ferris and Sloane head down the street. Cameron follows. FERRIS AND SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant old monolith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traders are frantically buying and selling commodities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cameron and Sloane are sitting in the gallery watching the proceedings. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you first. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I trash a day of education to be with you if I didn't love you? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I risk damaging a deep and wonderfully enriching relationship with my parents if I didn't love you? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I have introduced you as my wife if I didn't love you? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. That was a lie. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. Ferris puts his arm around Sloane. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you want to get married? I mean if I wasn't an asshole. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. FERRIS (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today? Sloane stares at him. Is he serious. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm game. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it, if you will. Cameron suddenly adds his two cents. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a blood test. Ferris looks around at him. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your blood's not compatible, you could produce a pinhead. The state requires a blood test. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you can't get married today. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get a blood test today. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting married. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, babe. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, why not? Think about it. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides being too young and your father hating my guts and not having any place to live and feeling awkward about being the only cheer- leader with a husband, give me a good reason why not. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you two. My mother and father. Ferris and Sloane look at him curiously. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're married and they hate each other. (to Ferris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen them. Am I right? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
