dialogues.text: You're father's a toad and your Mom's always wired out, but so what? They're old. That's natural. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me puke. Seeing people treat each other like that. It's like the car. He loves the car. He hates his wife. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are divorced. So what? It's not like it doesn't happen ten thousand times a day. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because it happens doesn't make it right. Are you comfortable with it? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not something I can get comfortable with. I've tried. Are yours divorced? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They may as well be. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they're staying together because of you? Cameron hasn't seen it that way. He shrugs. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they like you? It hasn't occured to Cameron that his parents might not l him. That parental love might not be a given. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider this...my father canned me and my brother and my Mom for a twenty five year old dipso with fake tits. He dropped us like a rock. Everything was cool at our house. I thought so. We all thought so. Then BLAM! It's over. FERRIS (to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all news to me. She keeps a pretty good secret. SLOANE (to Cameron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was pure selfishness. When I have a kid, I don't care how much I want something, if it's gonna screw-up the kid, forget it. FERRIS (to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not lying. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could change. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I'm gonna try not to. I'm gonna think about it. I'm gonna try to prevent it. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is optomism. It's a common trait with my age group. Adults think it's cute, it's like a charming quick that infests youth. But it's a cool thing and I think, deep down, crusty old shits wish they had some. They wish they had her, too. (points to Sloane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She's taken. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not have my family break apart, thank you. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know what? It ain't up to you. It's out of your hands. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I in other words, I should just sit back and watch it crumble? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're merely an inhabitant in their universe. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightening choice of words. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call the shots. When you split from them, you call the shots. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying I should run away? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's saying it's time for lunch. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go feed Cameron. They stand up and head out. Ferris hangs back a moment. H cups his hands to his mouth. He yells at the top of his voice. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: BUY
dialogues.text: And he exits. Cool and casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It explodes with activity in response to Ferris' shout. We HEAR A RADIO ANNOUNCER. ANNOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commodity prices rose sharply today in unusually heavy trading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A French restaurant on the Gold Coast.  It's noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Sloane and Cameron are standing in the restaurant Ferris is looking at the maitre 'd's reservations book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fingers runs down to a party of three for 12:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maitre'd returns. MAITRE'D (to Ferris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm Abe Frohman. Party of three for 12:00. The maitre'd looks at Ferris curiously. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? MAITRE'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Abe Frohman? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Abe Frohman. MAITRE'D (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, son. I'm very busy right now. If you have trouble finding the door... Sloane tugs Ferris' sleeve. He ignores her. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting that I'm not who I say I am? MAITRE'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I call the police? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go...Abe. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere. (to the Maitre'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police. Go ahead. Better yet... (grabs the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll call myself. Cameron chokes. Sloane grits her teeth. The maitre'd smil smuggly.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PHONE
dialogues.text: Ferris punches out a number. A beat and the restaurant's second line lights up and the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maitre'd motions for the phone so that he can answer call. Ferris waves him off angrily. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch me and I yell "rat!" There's another phone around here. Find it. The maitre'd backs off. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, let's split, please? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's right. We're gonna get busted. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance in the world. He hands the phone to Sloane. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask for Abe Frohman.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RESTAURANT. LATER
dialogues.text: Ferris, Sloane and Cameron are seated in the restaurant. maitre'd is hovering over Ferris. MAITRE'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your understanding. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't grovel, Charles. Just leave us to our repast and all will be forgotten. MAITRE'D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your luncheon. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The maitre'd backs away. Ferris smiles. Sloane is impress Cameron is flushed with nerves. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, you were wonderful. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but I had a wonderful teacher. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, dear friend? Cameron looks to Ferris. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought we wouldn't have any fun. Shame on you. Ferris disappears behind his menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR HALLWAY SOUNDS AND JEANIE. JEANIE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller's days are numbered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's sitting on a bench in a field hockey uniform. Sh talking to a FRIEND. JEANIE (mean, vicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna bust his buns. FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What's the point? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because I'm sick of the little dope. He manipulates my parents, he does whatever he wants, whenever he wants and he never gets nailed. (wicked pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, babe, today I'm the hammer. She yanks angrily on the velcro strap on her sneakers. Th straps rip off in her hand. FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's cute. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, it's an established fact that you have no taste. Ferris is not cute. He's not charming. He's not nice. He's not a wonderful person. He's an ignorant mule and the sooner everybody in this school comes to that realization the better off we'll all be. She displays the velcro straps to her friend. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? My brother strokes you, you sympathize with him, I get pissed off and this is what happens! Jeanie tosses the straps on the floor. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something. I study hard, I work hard, I'm polite, I'm considerate, I'm friendly and fair to all kinds of people. Except morons. I try to be everything a good, decent person should be and you know what? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody thinks you're an asshole. Jeanie freezes with her next sentence pinned to her tongu JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're an asshole. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who does? Her friend smiles sheepishly. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel? Jeanie's friend shrugs, wags her head, does everything bu verbally confirm. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's a dirt bag. Who else? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just forget it. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that everybody thinks I'm an asshole? Would you like everybody to think you're an asshole? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everybody thinks you're an asshole. Mr. Rooney likes you. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. That's exciting. A fat fifty year old clod with B.O. likes me. Jeanie shakes her head in disbelief. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would everybody be happier if maybe I were to die in a flaming car accident or something? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you didn't cat like and asshole... JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I acting like an asshole? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it that way. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I this a conspiracy to shit all over me or something? Is my brother behind this? Tell me if he is or I'll sock your tits. FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do have a problem, Jeanie. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I have a problem? FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody who threatens to sock people's tits has a problem. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. How about if I sock your face? Jeanie's friend gets up. FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a walk, Jeanie. Her friend exits. JEANIE (yells after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it means anything to you, I have my period! MY BODY'S RIDDING

dialogues.speaker: ITSELF OF OLD EGGS, GODDAMN IT
dialogues.text: She snarls and slumps against the lockers. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. He's over. He's monkey meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is standing at the urinal. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a person who views life as an ordeal that must be endured. Her body is a transport vehicle for her anger. I don't know where she gets this shit. Basically, the family's pretty cool. He looks down at the urinal. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if everybody shoots at cigarette butts in urinals? Probably not many women. (continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think that my family was the only one that had weirdness in it. It used to worry me. Then I met Cameron and I saw how his family functioned. He zips this trousers and steps away from the urinal. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's home life is really shit. He wasn't lying. That's why he's sick all the time. It really upsets him. What he said about his parents hating each other? I refuse to sleep over at his house. His parents fight all the time. Even when I'm there. Is there anything worse than being at somebody's house when their parents are fighting? It's the absolute height of social discomfort. He checks his hair in the mirror. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they go after each other, Cameron tightens up. It's scary. He gets so wadded-up, you couldn't pry his buns apart with a crowbar. The thing with taking his old man's car? It's good for him. It teaches him to deal with his fear. Plus, and I must be honest here, I love driving it. I highly recommend picking one up. He exists the men's room. We hold a beat. A toilet flushe Another beat and Tom walks out of the stall. He crosses t the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Sloane have been served their lunches. They'r staring at the plates. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But it looks like it's already been eaten and digested. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it was a mistake letting Ferris order for us. Ferris slides over to the table and drops into his seat. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Cameron looks at Ferris. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this shit? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me. I don't speak French. He puts his napkin in his lap and smells his plate. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a land-based beefoid creature. He takes a bite. He savors the taste. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superb. Cameron and Sloane try theirs. They chew tentatively. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good? Sloane and Cameron shrug. It's not bad. A WAITER passes. Ferris stops him. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Clouseau! The waiter stops and looks at Ferris indignantly. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a growth on my brain that causes memory lapses. Could you tell me what we ordered here? The waiter glances at the plates. WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetbreads. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh. And what might that be? WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pancreas. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in the gland that has important functions in digestion and metabolism?

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE AND CAMERON
dialogues.text: They stop chewing. They're holding their sweetbreads in t mouths.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He continues his questioning. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That secretes a thick, colorless fluid containing digestive enzymes? The home of the world famous isles of Langerhans?

dialogues.speaker: CU. WAITER
dialogues.text: He nods broadly, knowing that he's spoiling the kids' mea

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE AND CAMERON
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He pats his mouth with his napkin. He looks to Cameron an Sloane. He raises a finger, holds it a beat and gives a c

dialogues.speaker: CU. WAITER
dialogues.text: He turns away as Sloane and Cameron spit out their food.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He watches Sloane and Cameron then glances at the waiter. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his two GUESTS are standing at the curb, talking. cab is waiting. The door's open. In the B.G. Ferris, Sloa and Cameron come out of the restaurant. They approach the cab. Tom's back it to Ferris. Ferris stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS, SLOANE, CAMERON
dialogues.text: They turns on cue at Tom, now in the B.G., turns toward t restaurant. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40,000 restaurants in the downtown area and I pick the one my father goes to. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get nabbed, for sure. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Cameron. Only the meek get nabbed. The bold survive. Let's go. He turns to the cab. Sloane and Cameron turn slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his party are still jawing at curbside. Ferris, Sloane and Cameron slowly approach the cab. Behind the ba of the men, Ferris scoots Sloane into the cab. Cameron dashes in. The Ferris hops the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAB DOOR HANDLE
dialogues.text: A man's hand reaches for the handle as the cab pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his guests watch in bewilderment at their cab tak off. MUSIC COMES UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand old Chicago museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main gallery is crowded with school kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A class of kids walking along holding hands. Among the second graders are Ferris, Sloane and Cameron, holding ha looking like giant grade schoolers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby chicks are hatching in a huge, round incubator. Sloa Ferris and Cameron are intently watching the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane, Ferris and Cameron ride in the coal train in the coal mine replica. Ferris and Sloane are making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane operates a metal press to produce a tin ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant, walk-thru replica of a human heart. Ferris stagg out of it, clutching his heart, feigning a massive heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is examining the controls of the captured U-Boat. checks to see if he's being watched then he presses a but and pulls a lever.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PROPELLER
dialogues.text: For the first time in forty years, the screw turns.

dialogues.speaker: CU. HUMAN FETUS IN A BOTTLE
dialogues.text: The famous stages of life display which features bottled fetuses. The ninth month. A tiny human being in a jar.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE, FERRIS, CAMERON
dialogues.text: Sloane wants to cry. Cameron's stomach is in his throat. Ferris is lost in thought. The MUSIC ENDS. SLOANE (remorsefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if he has a name? FERRIS (blank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninth Month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Merchandise Mart, looking down the fetid, green swath of water. A boat is rolling up the man-made canyon. CAMERON (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys worried about nuclear war? FERRIS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, it's a beautiful day, we've won our freedom, we're traveling down one of American's most scenic polluted waterways and you have to bring up nuclear war? SLOANE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is kind of raggy subject, Cam. CAMERON (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless. It's with us every day. The possiblity of global destruction. SLOANE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's an issue because people need something to worry about? They have to like, have some major problem that puts all their little bullshit into some kind of persepective? CAMERON (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to have Viet Nam. They used to have the oil crisis stuff and Iran. That's over and people have to have their big issue. It's not like somebody came up with the nuclear holocaust yesterday at noon, you know. SLOANE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To answer your question...No, I'm not worried about it at all. FERRIS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know when the bombs going off. We do know, however, that college starts in the fall. CAMERON (VO) (dramatic, deadly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what a nuclear winter is? Long beat. SLOANE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everybody's dead, it's real cold and the skiing's for shit. The boat makes the turn in the river and CLEARS FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three are sitting on the aft deck of the tour boat. Their feet are up on the railing. Very casual, very relax Discussing the end of the world. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My step-father's always going off about how when he was young he was committed to all these causes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's full of shit. All the old hippies are full of shit. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says I don't care about things like he did. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he care about now? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baldness, fatty meats and money. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rest my case. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's spooky is they still control everything. They took over when they were young and they never gave it up. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the most frightening experiences of my young life has been observing my parents and our neighbors playing the Baby Boom Edition of Trivial Pursuits. It's chilling to see people crazed with the minutia of their past. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's human nature to like what you had better than what you have. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. A loud speaker on the boat identifies a point of interest LOUDSPEAKER

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING...
dialogues.text: The three look to the left. LOUDSPEAKER, FERRIS, SLOANE, CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sears Tower. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is all very interesting but I'm starving. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour ago you wanted to yack. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel better now. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean over and grab a fish. Cameron looks over the side of the boat. An obtuse though flashes through Sloane's brain. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What comes after a nuclear winter? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuclear spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie is having a small moral debate with herself. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's reprehensible to squeal on your own flesh and blood...but it's for his own good. His cavalier attitude will get him into trouble later in life...and it'll continue to piss me off and I'll get so wadded-up that it'll cause cervex cancer and he'll ruin my life. Screw him. She slips into the Dean's outer office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's secretary is behind her desk. Jeanie walks in. T secretary looks up and greets her with a weary smile. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jeanie. Who's bothering you now? Jeanie scowls at her. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Dean Rooney in? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, he's out. Can I help you? JEANIE (condescending)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seriously doubt it. When's he back? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He left the grounds on personal business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car tire rolls into FRAME and stops. Slide across to th sidewalk. Rooney's dress shoe steps out onto the pavement Move up to reveal Rooney standing at the door of his bile-green LeBaron. Rooney peels off his shades and looks around like he's Dirty Harry. In his mind he is Dirty Har

dialogues.speaker: CU. FIRE HYDRANT
dialogues.text: Rooney's dres shoe on the hydrant. He ties his lace and pulls up his sock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney straightens his tie and jacket and slips into a ro hot dog joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's jammed with construction workers, secretaries, subur businessmen. It's loud and confusing. Rooney pushes his w in and scopes the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young person is playing a video game in a far corner.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He suspects it's Ferris. It look sort of like Ferris. He smiles and cuts into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CU. THE BACK OF THE VIDEO PLAYER'S HEAD
dialogues.text: MOVE IN on the player. ROONEY (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting a long time for this. The player looks up. ROONEY (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ass is mine. The player turns around. It's a GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: The blood evacuates his face. He stares at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She stares at him. She picks up her Coke. She puts the st to her lips and sucks.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He's still staring. He can't think of anything to say.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: Holding the straw in the mouth, she draws it out of the c She raises it, pointing it directly in Rooney's face.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He squints

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She blows a strawful of Coke in Rooney's face.

dialogues.speaker: CU. NAPKIN HOLDER
dialogues.text: A hand yanks a napkin hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney wipes his face. Behind him is the kitchen and a grease-covered TV set broadcasting a Cubs baseball game. There's a long foul ball. The TV camera follows the ball into the stands. A kid makes a stab at the ball. Rooney wipes his suit off. The TV camera zooms in on the boy triumphantly holding the foul ball aloft. It's Ferris. He does a little celebration dance. Rooney wads up the napkin and tosses it in a trashbin. The TV camera returns the game. Rooney glances at the screen. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the score? HOT DOG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero to zero. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's winning? HOT DOG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cubs. Rooney nods and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sits down with the baseball. He shakes his stingin paw. On either side of him are Cameron and Sloane. Camero scarfing nachos. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I broke my thumb. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we leave now? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to leave? We just got here. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a call, you broke your thumb, what's left to do? Cameron offers his nachos to Sloane. She looks at them wi disgust. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder you're always sick. Ferris leans back, puts his hands behind his head and tur his face to the bright sun. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize that if I played by the rules, right now I'd be in gym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy's gym class is doing laps. A blue Fiat pulls into t shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's at the wheel. She sneaks a glance at the school. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe my brother's making me put myself in a position where I could get expelled. Selfish little moron. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris? You're overshadowed me long enough. I'm gonna get you, buddy. She puts the car in gear and drives out of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parade is underway. Floats and politicians. Marching bands, drum and bugle corps, soldiers, school kids. Figur skating club in outfits and skates performing their routi on pavement. It's GERMAN-AMERICAN APPRECIATION DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding atop on a float is Ferris. He's waving to the crow He and half a dozen homely German-American Beauty Queens. He's leading the girls in singing, "DANKE SHOEN".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watching Ferris go by. They wave to him. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love him. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard not to. Cameron breaks a smile. As worried as he is about the day and getting caught, he has to admire Ferris for his lack inhabitions. Cameron mumbles a few words. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop...water...want... SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in reincarnation? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that you lived before? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sort of. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO you ever wonder what you were? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to wonder. I know. Sloane looks at him with amazement. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a tractor tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is on his knees, reaching down from the float, shaking hands with people in the crowd. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten tag, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane and Cameron continue their conversation. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you in a previous life? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure but I think I know who Ferris was. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannibal. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the A-Team? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The guy who rode the elephants into Switzerland. Sloane laughs at herself. They step out of the crowd and head down the street in the direction the parade's headin SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think if he was anybody, he was Magellan. You know, the guy who went around the world. Cameron nods. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could see him ignoring popular belief and taking off on some impossible mission. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. As long as I've known him, everything works for him. There's nothing he can't handle. I can't handle anything. School, parents, the future. Ferris can do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is playing "TWIST AND SHOUT" on the accordian. The girls on the float are singing. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: WELL, SHAKE IT UP, BABY, NOW
dialogues.text: GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE IT UP, BABY
dialogues.text: FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: TWIST AND SHOUT
dialogues.text: GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: TWIST AND SHOUT
dialogues.text: FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: COME ON AND WORK IT ON OUT
dialogues.text: GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue their conversation. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The future's worse for a boy, isn't it? Cameron doesn't understand what she means. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl can always bail out and have a baby and get some guy to support her. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty grim thought. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, but it's an option. No options is worse. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but to do what? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you interested in? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either. They walk on for a few beats. We HEAR "TWIST AND SHOUT" GROWING LOUDER AND LOUDER. The sons is taking over all th other tunes in the band. It's infecting the entire parade CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think Ferris is gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing TWIST AND SHOUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's singing. POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A band of PUNKS are dancing on the roof of a news kiosk. PUNKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN and her two TODDLERS sing along. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: YOU KNOW YOU LOOK SO FINE
dialogues.text: TODDLERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wearing a shower cap and a maroon overcoat. TEENAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He singing along. NEWSPAPER SELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're marching down the parade. They're singing in thei angleic voices. CHOIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With their brooms ready... STREET CLEANERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire parade is singing and playing "TWIST AND SHOUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLITICIANS and their WIVES stand up. POLITICIANS AND WIVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLERGYMEN stand. CLERGYMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marching in formation and in WWII uniforms. VETERANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris leads the Beauty Queens in the rousing finale. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire parade is at frenzy pitch. PARADE

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHH
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF THE VOICES blends with the SOUND OF A RED-LI HIGH PERFORMANCE ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Port of Chicago. Grim, gritty waterfront. Suddenly, Cameron's father's car flies OVER CAMERA. Like the openin shot in Star Wars. The Starship Ferrari. SLO-MO.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRARI UNDER-CARRIAGE
dialogues.text: It travels past to reveal a beautiful blue sky. SLO-MO.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PARKING ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: His eyes are wide with exhilaration. Mouth open, tongue o Maniac at the wheel. SLO-MO.

dialogues.speaker: CU. RASTAMAN
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed. Big smile. SLO-MO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looking up in the air, following the car as it fl over them. Broad, excited smiles. The car's shadow passes over them. SLO-MO.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAR GRILLE
dialogues.text: It fills the frame and stops. We MOVE UP to reveal Rooney behind the wheel of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney gets out of his car. He looks at the house, looks and down the street, then crosses to Ferris' house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's at the front door. We see him peek in a window a the top of the door. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It acknowledges the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CASSETTE PLAYER
dialogues.text: It clicks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house intercom activates. We HEAR FERRIS' VOICE. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Rooney presses the intercom. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ed Rooney, Ferris. I'd like to have a word with you. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I can't come to the door right now. I'm very ill and I'm afraid that in my weakened condition, I could take a nasty spill down the stairs and subject myself to further school absenses. There's a pause. Rooney presses the intercom again. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B.S. Come down here. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can reach my parents at their places of business. Thank you for stopping by. I appreciate your concern for my well-being. It will be remembered long after this illness has past. His voice clicks off. Rooney presses the intercom again. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving until you come down and talk to me. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day. Rooney presses the intercom. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving, Ferris. There's no response. Rooney rings the doorbell again. The pre-recorded litany starts over. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Rooney doesn't realize that he's listening to a recording ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get smart with me Ferris! FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I can't come to the door right now. I'm very ill and I'm afraid that in my weakened condition... Rooney leans back from the door. He can't quite figure ou what's going on. But's it's highly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney steps through the hedges and peeks in the windows. HEAR FERRIS' VOICE inside. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may reach my parents at their places of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney tries to peak in the kitchen window. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your conern for my well-being. It will be remembered long after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black rubber doggie door. The type that allows a dog to come and go as it pleases. Rooney is crouched down. He li the doggie door and peeks in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the kitchen floor. Through the kitchen, into the dining room. We hear a LARGE DOG GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He's peaking through the door. He hears the dog. His face freezes. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Rottweiler bursts through the doggie door in a fury of gnashing teeth and foam.

dialogues.speaker: CU. LARGE BREASTS
dialogues.text: Tassled pasties twirl like airplane propellers.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON, FERRIS AND SLOANE
dialogues.text: They're sitting in a booth in the garish, nearly deserted strip joint. Cameron's mouth is open in amazement. Sloane embarrassed and revolted. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does she do that? One goes one way, one goes the other. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably schizophrenic. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, this is nauseating me. Really. I'm losing respect for you by the bucket. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think it's amazing that we got in? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to get in? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron looks like a toddler, for Christ's sake. I'm talking about a major achievement in false identification. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in watching someone jiggle their mammary glands. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point well taken. But consider why she does it. Why she does it and you don't. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a tramp. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe her life fell apart. Maybe she lost somebody. A lover. A boyfriend. A parent. A child... (to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of thing makes me a little depressed. You may think because I'm the age I am that I'm a sex maniac. That sex is all I think about. But that's not true. I'm a romantic. I think alot of people my age are. We think about love and matters of the heart. And SAT scores and acne aside, we worry about lonliness. It's a terrible thing. And we feel it. I feel it. He flips his collar up, curls his lip and affects an Elvi impression. A sappy, do-wop track FADES UP. The club ligh go down. Cameron and Sloane disappear into darkness. Ferr stands up from the booth. He strolls slowly through the empty club as the stripper bumps and grinds in a pool of blue light. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, someone said the world's a stage and each must play a part. Fate had me playing in love, with you as my sweetheart. Act one was when we met. I loved you at first glance. You read your lines so cleverly and never missed a cue. Then came act two. You seemed to change. You acted strange. And why, I've never known. He climbs up on the little runway. The stripper disappear in darkness as Ferris takes over the spotlight. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you lies when you said you loved me and I had no cause to doubt you. But I'd rather go on hearing your lies than to go on living without you. Now, the stage is bare and I'm standing there with emptiness all around and if you won't come back to me, then they can bring the curtain down... Elvis fades up. The orignal recording. Ferris lip synchs with the big, dramatic florish that was the King's tradem ballad sign-off. ELVIS

dialogues.speaker: TELL ME DEAR, ARE YOU LONESOME TONIGHT
dialogues.text: Ferris drops his head. Like the King would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's father is looking at the car. He's studying it. looks terribly familiar. He leans into the open car and reaches for the glovebox to see if the contents will conf if it's his. He freezes. He looks up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant and the Rastaman are glowering at him. They holding bags of fried chicken. ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for something in my car?

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON'S FATHER
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, no. CAMERON'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's standing at her car. She's staring incredulously into the distance. Her mouth's open. She's shaking her he slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spray-painted on the town water tower in gigantic black letters -- SAVE FERRIS BUELLER.

dialogues.speaker: CU. JEANIE
dialogues.text: She's furious. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna microwave his nuts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Sloane and Cameron in the backseat of a checker. Ferris is on one window, Cameron on the other. Sloane's i the middle. Ferris is talking to the DRIVER. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... He leans forward and reads the driver's name off the city license. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Yuri, how long have you been in America? DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One year. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your overall impression? DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very good here. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than Russia? DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better here than in Russia. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly you've never been to an American high school. Ferris sits back. He puts his arm around Sloane. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late, Ferris. I have to get the car home. I know you don't care, but it means my ass. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't care? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't care. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hurts, Cameron. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump back, Ferris, Cameron's been a good sport. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, what'd you see today? Cameron looks at him. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw four states, a submarine, a giant heart, seventy five dollars worth of cooked pancreas, two of the most incredible breasts ever to come out of modern plastics, major league baseball and... (quizical look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna chuck your nachos? Cameron's staring past Ferris. He's frozen. Ferris realiz he's looking at something out the window. He turns. He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gridlock traffic, their cab is squeezed tight alongside another cab. In that cab is Tom. He's about a f from Ferris. He turns and looks right into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris' frozen face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom glances back at his paper. He pauses. Looks up. Think Turns back to CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane is sitting where Ferris was. She's wearing sunglasses, looking bored. She turns and glances out the window. Fakes a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stares at her. He's baffled. He looks away. INT. CAB. FLOOR. Cameron and Ferris are on the floor. On their asses, with their backs to the back of the front seat, feet up on the seat. FERRIS (to Sloane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing? SLOANE (revolted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking at me and he's licking the glass and making obscene gestures with his hands. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Sloane bursts out laughing. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roast! She licks her finger and touches Ferris knee. She makes a sizzling sound. She collapes on the seat in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's looking into Ferris' cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane's bouncing up and down.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TOM
dialogues.text: He can't quite figure out what's going on. He turns and slowly raises his newspaper over his face. We see on the back of the paper a small story with the headline: COMMUN RALLIES AROUND SICK YOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rottweiler's chewing on a shoe. Tearing it apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's standing outside the fence. He's missing a shoe. His suit pants are torn from the crotch to the knee. His suit coat pocket is torn off. His hair's messed and there're grass-stains on his knees and elbows. He's looking in at dog. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a $28.00 dress shoe, you worthless mutt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rottweiler leaps at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is leading the way down Michigan Avenue. He's hustling through the crowd. He has Sloane by the hand. Sh jogging to keep up. Cameron's a few steps behind. He keep bumping into people. Ferris and Sloane make the turn at Wacker Driver and disappear into the Stone Container Building. Cameron follows, mumbling again. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money...tits...please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A florist truck pulls up in front of the house. A DELIVER MAN gets out iwth a huge floral arrangement. He heads up the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's sitting on the porch patting a bloody knee with handkerchief. The delivery man hops up on the steps. Roon looks up at him. He greets Rooney cheerily. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy! He presses the doorbell. A beat and we hear Ferris' recording. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? The Deliver Man presses the intercom. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus on Flowers. I have a delivery. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but I can't come to the door right now. I'm very ill and I'm afraid...

dialogues.speaker: ROONEY FERRIS' VOICE
dialogues.text: It's a recording, asshole.        ...that in my weakened condition, I could take a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIVERY MAN            nasty spill and subject What's your problem?              myself to further schoo absenses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROONEY                        (pause) He's one of my students.          You can reach my parent at their places of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIVERY MAN            business. Thank you for Little bugger's dying.            stopping by. I apprecia your concern for my well-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROONEY                  being. It will be What?                             remembered long after this illness has passed. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I heard it from our mailman he was supposedly born with only half a kidney. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day. DELIVERY MAN (to the intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the details. But my boss had to send to Milwaukee to get more orchids. He's very popular. Rooney is flabbergasted. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's home here? ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be around for awhile? ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine so. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna keep an eye on these? Rooney looks at the flowers. Then he looks at the Deliver Man. DELIVERY MAN (happy sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really touches me that so many people are rallying behind this guy. I guess there's hope for the human race afterall. He hands the arrangement to Rooney. DELIVERY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta run. He bounds off the porch and trots to the truck. Rooney lo incredulously at the arrangement. He opens the attached card. ROONEY (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ...

dialogues.speaker: CU. CARD
dialogues.text: It's signed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number one afternoon FM rock'n roll D.J. is sitting behind his microphone. D.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who that was or what they were playing but I apologize for it nonetheless. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a guest with me today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He put his headphones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's car pull in the driveway. We hear her car radio. D.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Ferris Mueller. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bueller. Ferris Bueller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into shock. Her eyes blink, her head cocks. D.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. Jeanie draws back and punches out her radio.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAR ANTENNA
dialogues.text: The impact of her blow to the radio shoots the antenna in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris leans forward and adjusts the microphone. D.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has an incredible story. Ferris turns to CAMERA. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell a massive lie here. It's going to by very thick and very steamy. I think radio's a facinating medium, it challenges the imagination. Unlike television which provides the images, radio... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this. Anyway, it's always been a dream of mine to be on the radio. I have what I consider to be an excellent broadcast voice. I practise it in the bathroom all the time. I used to play records and do introductions to them. But I've never had the chance to sit behind a microphone and try it out for real. This is a 50,000 watt outlet. I'm going out to several million people so let me just say, I'm in a very pleasant groove right now. (clears his voice, speaks into the mike, affects a "radio" voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Steve, you and your listeners are probably not going to believe this but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of kids are sitting around a blaster. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm the first Chicago area youth to be selected to participate in a space shuttle mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris turns from the mike to CAMERA. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to say I knew Springsteen's home phone number and I was going to give out the number of the New Jersey State Police but I thought I might get busted. After I got flunked in driver's ed for sideswiping a mail box, which was not in any way, shape or from my fault. I was putting out a cigarette, like I was told. It was weird. I'm so used to getting in a car and lighting up, because I'm not allowed to smoke at home, that I got in the driver's ed. car and spaced completely, pulled out of the lot, lit up a 'boro and Mrs. Heller looked at me like I'd just pulled a bunny out of my nose or something and I realized what the hell I was doing and I went to put it out and hit the mail box. Anyway, I was so pissed off at her reaction to the whole thing that I considered running an ad in a sleaze magazine for a school teacher that does phone sex and I was gonna use Mrs. Heller's home number but is cost too much. I took it again and passed. But I had to work at Burger King to get the cash to pay for the driver's ed. car. The car got fixed in auto shop for nothing and I think Rooney pocketed the cash. But I can't prove it? I'm in high school, remember? He turns back to the DJ. D.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get picked for this. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of a long story but I've been doing alot of programming for NASA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A even larger group of kids is listening to the blaster. They're cheering him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rottweiler is laying unconscious on the lawn. The flo arrangement is scattered all over the yard and the cerami vase the flowers were in has obviously struck the dog. Th broken pieces are all around the dog's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smiling with great satisfaction. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tight, pooch. He hears something in the house. His head snaps around. H drops down and peek in the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimpse of a fleeting figure.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: His eyes dance in anticipation of revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie kicks the door open. The yardstick flings the cove and the pillows beneath them in the air. She stomps in an turns off the snoring synthesizer. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! She grabs the phone and sits down. She dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney sneaks around the side of the house. He slinks up the porch. The front door's open. He peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's on the phone. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mrs. Bueller there? Where is she? This is her daughter. Do you know where she is? Do you know when she'll be back? Do you know anything? She slams the phone down. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm has luck like clams have body odor... She's startled by a noise downstairs. A smile spreads acr her face. He's back and she's going to nail him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney sneaks into the house. He looks around the foyer a heads into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie tiptoes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney sneaks through the kitchen into the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie comes down the stairs into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney comes out of the den, back into the kitchen. He crosses back toward the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie sneaks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie and Rooney come face-to-face. Jeanie squeals in horror. She doesn't recognize Rooney as himself but as an intruder. She drops into a karate stance and kicks Rooney the face. He hits the deck. She flees back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd is sitting in the backseat of Joyce's car listening the radio. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My input on the Star Wars defense plan was pretty substantial so I guess this is their way of rewarding me. I'm pretty flattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and her clients leave a show house and head toward car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd looks out the window as his parents and Joyce appear D.J. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stay around and take a few phone calls? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really like to but I have a kidney operation in about an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and her clients take one last look at the house. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're willing to commit a little time and a little money to this place, you can really have something to be proud of. Don't let the black living room throw you off. She opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. D.J. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you the best of luck. FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Steve. D.J. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very interesting guy, Ferris Bueller. Joyce gets in. The clients get in the other side. A song starts. JOYCE (to the kid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Boyd, how are you bearing up? The kid stares at her. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I have a son your age? BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Ferris. I think you'd like him. Boyd sits up in the seat at the mention of Ferris' name. BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he going up in the space shuttle in September? Joyce looks around at Boyd. She gives him a curious look. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I know of. BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he was bullshitting. MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth. BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you watch your mouth? JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know my son? FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pay any attention to him. He thinks it's cute to bait adults. BOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's cute. I think it's fun. Joyce give him a puzzled smile and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's on the phone. She's in a panic. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a phoeny phone call. There's an intruder, male caucasian, possibly armed, certainly weird, in our kitchen. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Bueller. There's another pause. Jeanie's face drops. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's real nice that you hope my brother's feeling better but I'm in danger, okay? I'm very cute, I'm very alone and I'm very protective of my body. I'd rather not have it violated or killed. I need help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's plugging his bloody nose with paper towel. The intercom goes on. JEANIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. If whoever's in the house is still in the house, I'd like you to know that I have just called the police. If you have any brains whatsoever, you'll get your ass out of my house real quick. Rooney stiffens with fear. JEANIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd also like to add that I have my father's gun. And a scorching case of herpes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's car is hooked to a tow truck. It's parked in fro of a fire hydrant and the windshield is decorated with parking citations. In the distance SIRENS WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three are waiting for the Ferrari. We HEAR TIRES SQUEALING, AN ENGINE REVING-OUT. Then the Ferrari pulls d the ramp and jams to a frightening stop. A BLACK GUY jump out. Ferris hands him the parking stub. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out of curiosity, what was your top speed coming down the ramp? BLACK GUY (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 60. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunning! He hands him a buck and opens the door and pulls the passenger seat forward for Cameron. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is probably the last time you'll have to ride back here. Keep that in mind. Cameron gives him a look and squeezes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari cruises through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane's in the passenger seat. Ferris is driving and Cameron is crammed in the back. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. We return the car. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go to my house. My parents aren't coming home until late. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have enough cash left for a quick flight to Peoria and back. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. Ferris looks in the mirror and changes lanes. He glances down at the speedometer, then to the road. And back to th speedometer. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? How many miles did you say this thing had when we left? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred and twenty six and halfway between three and four tenths. Why? How many miles are on it now? He glances down at the speedometer.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: The odometer reads 432.7. FERRIS (to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's where Cameron goes berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari pulls up at a stop light. We HEAR A THUNDERIN MUFFLED SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari is buzzing through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane turns in her seat and looks at Cameron. Her gestur is one of genuine support. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: His eyes are frozen in a mindless, vacant stare.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He looks at Sloane. He's concerned. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cameron. It's okay. We'll fix it.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He's still holding the stare. He starts to breathe heavil He's trembling.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She whips around in the seat and grabs his arms. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron! Cut it out! What's wrong?! Ferris!

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He shoots Sloane a look. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, are you okay? It's no problem, really. Your old man won't know a thing. It's completely fixable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane fires an angry look at Ferris. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up! It is a problem! For him it's a problem. Nothing's a problem for you. But it's a problem for him! So, just shut-up. She turns back to Cameron. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do, Cameron?

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: Eyes front. He knows what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings. The Ferris' tape is activated. FERRIS VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? We hear a MALE VOICE over the intercom. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody home? FERRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry that I can't come to the door right now... The tape continues as Jeanie hurtles down the stairs. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saved! Thank you, God! Thank you, thank you, thank you! She jumps the last few stairs and slides to the front doo She whips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank...you... Her jaw goes slack. She blinks her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delivery Man and a young ASSISTANT are standing at th door with floral arrangements. Spread all around them are more flowers. A sexy singing NURSE and a BALLOON MAN step up on the porch. NURSE (sings)

dialogues.speaker: WE...
dialogues.text: The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's walking down the street. A school bus is crawlin alongside him as kids hang out the windows. From inside w hear SHOUTING and seventeen different SONGS PLAYING ON BLASTERS. A top forty montage. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Rooney! What're you doing? Rooney doesn't respond. ANOTHER KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get in a fight? Rooney keep walking. The bus doors open. The DRIVER calls out to him. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a lift? Rooney takes a few more steps. He stops. The bus stops. Rooney takes a deep breath. He climbs aboard the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is jammed with WONKS and WEINERETTES. The passeng are silent as they watch Rooney shuffle down the aisle an take an empty seat next to a skinny, myopic GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She looks at Rooney and smiles. She pushes her Coke bottl glasses up on her nose.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He looks vacantly at her.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She holds her smile. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you never smelled a real school bus before.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She holds up a candy package. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gummi Bear?

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: CU. GIRL
dialogues.text: She puts one in her mouth. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been in pocket. They're real soft and warm.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BOY
dialogues.text: A rotund FRESHMAN BOY sitting across from Rooney is stari at him.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He looks across to the kid.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BOY
dialogues.text: He leans forward. FRESHMAN BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of like being in the belly of the beast isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He turns him eyes to the front. The bus jerks forward and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It grinds through the gears as it heads down the quiet street. The BLASTERS go back on, the SHOUTING RESUMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's laying on a picnic table. Sloane's sitting besi him on the table. She's stroking his hair. Ferris WALKS I THE FOREGROUND. He addresses CAMERA. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may very well be for real. I think Cameron might have blown a micro-chip or two. He's always been a little keyed-up. All I wanted to do was give him a good day. We're gonna graduate in a couple of months. Then we have the summer. He'll work and I'll work. And we'll see each other at night and on the weekends but then he'll go to one school and I'll go to another. And basically that'll be it. As much as we like each other, the process of growing up will separate us. He begins to walk. We follow him. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane's a bigger problem. She still has another year of high school. How do I deal with that? I was serious when I said I'd marry her. I would. This isn't just teenage infatuation. That's what my parents call it. What do they call what they have? If that's love, I'll take infatuation.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed. Sloane's stroking his hair. FERRIS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's never been in love. At least no one's ever been in love with him. He's gonna marry the first girl he lays. And she's gonna treat him like shit because he's gonna kiss her ass for giving him what he's built-up in his mind as the end-all, be-all of human existance. She won't respect him because you can't respect someone who kisses your ass. It just doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She's studying Cameron's face. She looks away. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris?

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He looks to the picnic table. Then back to CAMERA. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being tested here. He starts back to the picnic table. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best friend has flipped-out. Conventional wisdom would suggest a visit to the nearest trauma center. I wouldn't fault anybody for doing that. My, personally, I think this calls for something new, something bold, something wet and wild.

dialogues.speaker: CU. JACUZZI JET
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER SHOT. A hyrdojet spews a gush of air bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BLASTER
dialogues.text: A finger pushes the PLAY button on the cassette. MUSIC CO UP.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BEER CAN LID
dialogues.text: The finger pops a beer.

dialogues.speaker: CU. OREO PACKAGE
dialogues.text: A painted fingernail pierces the cellophane wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Sloane are in Sloane's parents' Jacuzzi. Their clothes are tosssed around the deck. Cameron's been place in a patio chair at the edge of the Jacuzzi. He's still catatonic. He's mummbling softly. Ferris is drinking a be Sloane's eating Oreos. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feeling any better, Cameron? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water's really nice. I wish you'd come in.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: Staring into space. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgery...fire...move...

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE AND FERRIS
dialogues.text: They look at each other. She offers him a cookie. He offe her his beer. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? Do you think this because of the car or is it a combination of everything shitty in your life?

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music...kiss...attack...

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE AND FERRIS
dialogues.text: Sloane sips the beer. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't deal with anymore shit? The car took you into the red zone? Time for a reality check? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? I could flip real easy, too. There's nothing wrong with it. At one time or another, everybody goes to the zoo. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he was actually sick. Maybe he wasn't bullshitting himself.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: No response. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gesundheit...God...mercy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Sloane watch their catatonic friend.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She leans forward and stares at Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He cocks his head, wondering what Cameron's up to.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He keels over forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron falls out of the chair and splashes down, face-first, into the water. Sloane screams. Ferris leaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris struggles with Cameron's lifeless bulk.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She's screaming. Ferris thrashes around in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris grabs Cameron's collar and rips him out of the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sits Cameron on the edge of the Jacuzzi. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed. He's lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: His face is a mask of terror. He shakes Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She's screaming.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: A smile spreads across his face.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He sees the smile. He stops shaking Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Cameron are looking at each other. Sloane's st screaming. She realizes that Cameron's okay. She stops screaming. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? FERRIS (Cameron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole! Cameron's smiling. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ferris starts to laugh. Cameron explodes with laughter. Sloane's bewildered. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie's sitting on a wooden bench with a WASTED TEENAGE in a Triumph t-shirt, long hair, torn jeans, creepers, st and chains. He's studying her. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I'm straight. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant, are you here for drugs? Jeanie stares at him. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I'm here. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you go home? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you put your thumb up your butt? The boy stares at her. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about your problem? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you? Are you serious? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm serious. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow yourself. Jeanie turns away. The boy crosses his legs. Jeanie looks back at him. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to know what's wrong? The boy shrugs. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. If you've got the time, I've got the troubles. In a nutshell, I hate my brother. How's that? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool. Did you shoot him or something? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet. The boy nods. He understands the emotion. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went home to confirm that the shithead was ditching school and a guy broke into the house and I called the cops and they picked me up for making a phoney phone call. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care if your brother ditches school? Jeanie stares at the boy. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should he get to ditch school when everybody else has to go? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could ditch. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd get caught. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're pissed at him because he ditches and doesn't get caught? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically. The boy nods knowingly. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then your problem is you. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse you. You oughta spend a little more time dealing with yourself and a little less time worrying about what your brother does. It's just an opinion. Jeanie stares angrily at him. Partly because he's so bold and partly because he's so right. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's somebody you should talk to. Jeanie stares at him threateningly. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say Ferris Bueller, you lose a testicle. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: CU. JEANIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: It curls into a fist.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRARI TIRE
dialogues.text: It's spinning rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: CY. ACCELERATOR
dialogues.text: A brick's resting on the accelerator, holding it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cameron and Sloane are sitting in the garage. The Ferrari is jacked up. The wheels are turning. The engine' racing. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole time I was just thinking things over. I was like, meditating. I was thinking about the future. And I realized it doesn't make and difference if the present goes to shit. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a agree with you there. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking all day that if you could only have the use of one word, what would it be? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane is naked before your eyes and you're thinking about words? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you, Cameron. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sloane. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you guys only had one word, what would it be? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you'd think up something like with a naked girl in a jacuzzi right in front of you. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ferris, answer his question. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say... She thinks. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
