dialogues.text: It's the only word you could ever use. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is you loathe somebody? Are you going to say "love" every time you see them? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than "hello". FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellos' generic. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be generic? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's help. Cameron smiles at his wisdom. Ferris and Sloane think abo it. It's a good choice. Cameron gets up and walks to the Ferrari. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word is help. Cameron peeks in the window.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ODOMETER
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron pulls his head out of the car. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris? It's not working. Ferris looks up. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The miles aren't coming off, running it in reverse. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that might be a problem. Let's crack open the odometer and roll it back by hand. Cameron shakes his head. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a better idea. It's cool. He walks back around behind the Ferrari. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen years and I've never taken a stand. Now, I'm gonna do it. I'm taking a stand against my father, against my family, against myself, against my past, my present and my future. I will not sit idly by as events that affect me unfold to change the course of my life. I will take a stand and I will defend it. When my father comes home tonight, he's finally going to have to deal with me. Good or bad, I'm taking a stand.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He turns to CAMERA. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big U-2 fan.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She smiles proudly at Cameron. She applauds him.

dialogues.speaker: CU. CAMERON
dialogues.text: He's serious and determined. He has made up his mind and appears that it won't be changed by anyone but himself.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TIRES
dialogues.text: It's spinning wildly.

dialogues.speaker: CU. MERCEDES BUMPER
dialogues.text: Cameron's foot rests on the bumper. A beat and it gives a mighty shove.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TIRE
dialogues.text: The spinning tires slam down on the cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron has kicked the Ferrari off the jack. It squeals o of the garage in a cloud of blue tire smoke. A $50,000 unmanned investment heading backwards down a driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE AND FERRIS
dialogues.text: They're in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari shoots down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron watches the car go. He's strangely placcid about impending disaster. Ferris and Sloane are bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari travels down the driveway, across the street, over the curb into the wooded property opposite the house

dialogues.speaker: CU. TREE
dialogues.text: The Ferrari's brief journey ends as it smacks a tree trun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Sloane exchange baffled looks. They look at Cameron. He's proud and bold. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about? SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to be a dream. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron? One quick question. Why'd you do that? Cameron holds his proud posture for a beat. Then a look o bewilderment comes over his face. He shoots a look to Ferris. A puzzled look. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trashed the car. Cameron looks across the street. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a stand. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Cameron. You wrecked a car. Cameron thinks for a moment. Then he regains his confiden CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Ferris looks across the street at the car. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea. If you're interested. Cameron looks at him. He shakes his head. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna handle it. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this could work. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. I want to deal with it by myself. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your one word? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already did it. If I need it again, I'll use it. He smiles. He raises am impish eyebrow. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. I'm loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce is talking with the juvenile officer. Outside the office, on the bench, we see Jeanie and the boy making ou JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never been in trouble before. This is a shock to me. First, I don't know why she wasn't at school. Second, I don't know why she'd call you with this story about a rapist. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For whatever reasons she did it, I think she'd had a good scare. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. I appreciate your calling me. I can assure you that her father and I will have a long talk with her. The gathers her purse and jacket and stands. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, I hope you son's feeling better. Joyce looks at the officer curiously. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, all the guys at the station here are pulling for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie quickly breaks the embrace with the boy as Joyce steps out of the juvenile officer's room. She's still a little bewildered that everybody knows Ferris was ill. Jeanie wipes her lips and sits up straight. The boy adjus his pants to better hide his passion. JEANIE (to the boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you keep this to yourself, I think we can probably get it on pretty good. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For sure. Jeanie stands up. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "hi" me, young lady. Get your stuff. Jeanie reaches down for her purse. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean. What's yours? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth Volbeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane and Ferris are standing at the back fence. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a great time today. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was pretty cool. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Cameron's gonna be alright? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He had to so it, I guess. His old man had it coming. He'll be okay. I'd be worried if he'd taken my idea. Sloane smiles knowingly. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have an idea, did you? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a glimmer. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so smart. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm just real loose. He kisses her. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tonight. Sloane nods. Ferris jumps the fence and takes off across backyards. Sloane watches him go. A huge smile spreads across her face. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE YOU
dialogues.text: She backs away from the fence. MUSIC FADES UP. SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna marry me. I know it. She turns and runs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sprints across a backyard. He jumps a plaster elf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris vaults a fence. He runs directly for a swimming po He's approaching it from the side. He leaps, hits the div board, springs off, does a flip and lands on the grass on the other side of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: CU. BEDSPREAD
dialogues.text: Neatly bundles stacks of bills and rolled coins. A significant amount of cash.

dialogues.speaker: CU. SLOANE
dialogues.text: She's writing.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PIECE OF PAPER
dialogues.text: We see a portion of the typewritten letter as she signs i "...in the amount of $1,765.33. It gives us great pleasure to assist you in performance of your worthy and much needed survives to those so desperately in need. Sincerely, Sloane Peterson Executive Director The Ferris Bueller Foundation"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running down the middle of the street. A car honks. Ferris moves to the side. The car pulls around him. INT. CAR. Tom's at the wheel. He glances in the mirror. He does a take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ferris cut across a front lawn and into a house.

dialogues.speaker: CU. TOM
dialogues.text: He realizes it couldn't be Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris runs through the kitchen, past a WOMAN, fixing din and out her backdoor. The Woman looks up curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pulls in the driveway. He parks and gets out. Joyce pulls in from the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris tries the door. It's locked. He reaches down and lifts the doormat.

dialogues.speaker: CU. PORCH
dialogues.text: The outline of a key in the dirt under the mat. The key's gone. The toe of a chewed-up dress shoe steps INTO FRAME. OMNIOUS CHORD IS STRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: He stares up in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney's looking down at him. He's holding the house key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris stands up. He smiles. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you, Ferris. This time I finally got you. Ferris is caught. There's no way out. Rooney gloats severely. ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does another year of high school sit with you? Suddenly, the backdoor opens. Jeanie looks out. She feign joy and relief. She rushes Ferris and hugs him. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God, you're alright! We've been worried sick!

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: A moment of curiosity. Then it dawns on him what's happening. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: His eyes dart from Ferris to Jeanie to Ferris. His victor is evaporating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie breaks the embrace. JEANIE (to Rooney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for bringing him home, Mr. Rooney. (to Ferris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get up in bed tight now. Ferris limps into the house. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine someone as sick as Ferris trying to walk home from the hospital? (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids!

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He's dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: CU. JEANIE
dialogues.text: She raises her hands and strikes a karate pose. A huge sm passes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: A look of terror as he realizes that is was Jeanie who kicked him and that Jeanie knows it was he who she kicked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanie steps into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes on Rooney's defeated, lost, dejected, bewildered face. Not only has he lost Ferris again, he ha Jeanie to deal with next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The click of the door wakes him up. His head pops up off grass.

dialogues.speaker: CU. ROONEY
dialogues.text: He senses new danger. We hear AN O.C. GROWL. Rooney squee his eyes shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimberly and Todd are sitting at the kitchen table watchi TV and eating cereal. They look up at Ferris as he comes from outside. TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris?  Does my head look like it's getting bigger? Ferris leans against the counter as he tries to catch his breath. He looks at his little brother. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but Kimberly's is. He crosses to the refrigerator and opens it. Kimberly fee her head. KIMBERLY (to Todd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he serious? TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Ferris takes out a bottle of orange juice out of the refrigerator and drinks straight from the bottle. Jeanie comes in. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jeanie. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I borrowed some cash from you. I'll pay you back. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. I've been ripping off your wallet for years. Ferris gives her a proud smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and Tom head up to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Jeanie exit the kitchen as Joyce and Tom enter JOYCE (to Todd and Kimberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys. KIMBERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my head swelling up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foyer is jammed with floral arrangements, plants and gifts. Ferris and Jeanie step gingerly through the flower and head upstairs. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I've been riding your buns for so long. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's completely cool. JOYCE (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris! Ferris continues up the stairs. He affects a sickly voice FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Jeanie stop. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know a guy named Garth Volbeck? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaguely. JEANIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he cool? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cool. But stay away from his brother. Ferris walks into the room, brushes the crumbs off his ha and peels off his shirt. He climbs into bed. No sooner ar the covers over him than the bedroom door opens and Joyce and Tom walk in. They walk over to the bed. Joyce sits do JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: The same deathly face he had in the morning. Tongue out, eyes bulging. TOM (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris? How do you feel? He pulls in his tongue to speak. FERRIS (deathly gasp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150% better, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Joyce hover over him with deep concern. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm much better, really. Please, don't make me stay home again. I want to go to school. I'm graduating in June and I... TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris. You're sick. There's no point pushing yourself and making it worse. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right, Dad. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm right. Joyce leans over and kisses him forehead. JOYCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get so sweet? FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years of practice. Tom pats Ferris on the rump. He and Joyce exit.

dialogues.speaker: CU. FERRIS
dialogues.text: The hideous face. A beat and we HEAR THE BEDROOM DOOR CLO Ferris looks at CAMERA. FERRIS (happy sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, life is a carousel. A great big crazy ball of pure living, breathing joy and delight. He rolls over on his back and puts his hands behind his head. FERRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get one. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: END TITLES
dialogues.text: THE END
